```{r, libraries}
library(tidyverse)
```

```{r, load data}
# source("COVID.Import.Data.R")
ELS.T3 = read.csv(file = "Data/ELS_T3_COVID_Curated.csv")
COVID = read.csv(file = "Data/ELS_COVID_CHILD_04.20.2020.csv")
```

```{r, wrangling}
# set up T3 inflammation data
df.blood = ELS.T3 %>% 
  drop_na(IL.1b_MFI) %>% 
  select(ELS_ID, Timepoint.T3, Sex, age_s2.T3,
         #contains("tscore"),
        # -contains("RADS"),
         114:127) %>% 
  mutate(IL.1b_MFI = log(IL.1b_MFI),
         IL.6_MFI = log(IL.6_MFI),
         IL.10_MFI = log(IL.10_MFI),
         TNF.a_MFI = log(TNF.a_MFI))
# head(df.blood)

# set up Covid timepoint
df.covid = COVID %>%
  drop_na(MASC_total.TC) %>%
  select(ELS_ID, Child_Age.TC,
         contains("MASC"),
         starts_with("PSS"))
# head(df.covid)

# merge df's together
df.merge = left_join(df.blood, df.covid, "ELS_ID") %>% 
  drop_na(MASC_total.TC) %>%
  select(-Timepoint.T3)
head(df.merge)
```

```{r correlations}
df.corr = df.merge %>% 
  select(-Child_Age.TC) %>% 
  select(contains("MFI"),
         contains("BMI"),
         contains("TC")) %>% 
  correlate() %>% 
  mutate_if(is.numeric, round, 3) 

df.corr


# correlation plot
p.corr_plot = df.corr %>% 
  rplot(colors = c("red","green")) + 
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 60, hjust = 1))
p.corr_plot
#ggsave("./Results/corr_plot.png", p.corr_plot)

# network plot
p.network_plot = df.corr %>% 
  network_plot(min_cor = 0.2,
               colors = c("red","white", "green"),
               repel = TRUE)
p.network_plot
#ggsave("./Results/network_plot.png", p.network_plot)

```

```{r write out dataset, eval = FALSE}
df.corr %>% 
  select(rowname,
         contains("TC")) %>% 
  filter(
    str_detect(rowname, 'TC', negate = TRUE)) %>% 
  rename(variable = rowname) %>% 
write_csv(path = "Results/covid_inflammation_corrs.csv", col_names = TRUE)

```

```{r tiffany's code for a pretty corrplot}
#generating the p-values:

cor.mtest <- function(mat, ...) {
    mat <- as.matrix(mat)
    n <- ncol(mat)
    p.mat<- matrix(NA, n, n)
    diag(p.mat) <- 0
    for (i in 1:(n - 1)) {
        for (j in (i + 1):n) {
            tmp <- cor.test(mat[, i], mat[, j], ...)
            p.mat[i, j] <- p.mat[j, i] <- tmp$p.value
        }
    }
  colnames(p.mat) <- rownames(p.mat) <- colnames(mat)
  p.mat
}
# matrix of the p-value of the correlation
p.mat <- df.corr %>% 
  select(-rowname) %>% 
  cor.mtest()
  
#head(p.mat[, 1:5]) #this will display first 5 variables


#plot the correlation matrix and cross-out those under p<0.05
par(cex=0.5) #aesthetics - adjust size of correlation est
corrplot(p.mat,method="number", tl.cex=0.8,tl.srt=70,type="upper", p.mat = p.mat, sig.level = 0.05)  
```
